imagenes.span: Leaf- N- fertilized peach tree in a highly N- deficiency orchard.
Symptoms of severe N- deficiency in peach shoots developing in spring.
Branches of a peach tree. Left, a normal tree. Right, a tree with severe nitrogen deficiency.
Leaf symptoms of K- deficiency in peach.
Apricot tree with symptoms of potassium deficiency.
Dâ€™Agen Prune cv.  Symptoms of potassium deficiency, during midsummer. Photography courtesy of Mr. Thomas Ficher, Agronomist.
Leaf symptoms of Mg- deficiency in peach.
Mahaleb cherry with magnesium deficiency, grown in a greenhouse using a nutritive solution but without magnesium.
Peach leaves with Fe- chlorosis. Top- healthy leaf.
Peach tree deficient in Fe.
D`Agen Prune sprout cd. with symptoms of iron deficiency.
Peach tree sector has an iron deficiency.
Peach trees affected by severe iron deficiency.
Peach trees affected simultaneously by iron and zinc deficiency.
Leaf symptoms of Mn- deficiency in peach.
Tip rosette removed from a Zn- deficient peach tree.
Plum shoots affected by severe Zn- deficiency.
Peach trees near chicken house. Half of the treetop is nurtured by its nearest roots, which present severe zinc and iron deficiency.
D`Agen Prune cv. severely affected by zinc deficiency, in the Spring.
Branches of D`Agen Prune cv. Right, severe symptoms of zinc deficiency.
